critique: This document primarily concerns amendments to civil service rules in 1896. It seems to focus on clarifying and refining the scope and application of these rules, particularly regarding which positions are included in the classified service and how promotions are handled. There's no immediately obvious ideological tilt, immigration stance, or impact on national security. The changes appear to be mostly administrative and aimed at improving the efficiency and fairness of the civil service. There is a slight move toward federal control as it standardizes civil service rules across states. There is also a slight move toward social inclusion as it requires that promotion boards not be composed of members of only one political party.
